Center: OECD/NEA Nuclear Data Bank, Boulogne-Billancourt, France
ref: Conf: Conf.proceedings by Am.Inst.of Phys., No.798, p.182 (2005)
title: Determination of the 243,246,248Cm thermal neutron induced fission cross sections

x4codes.shortRef: Conf: Conf.proceedings by Am.Inst.of Phys., No.798, p.182 (2005)

x4freetext: High flux reactor of the ILL
PF1B cold neutron guide of 76 m length.
Average neutron wave length 3.9 Angstrom corresponds
Flux was measured by U-235 sample (99.97% U-235,
16.5 ug mass) of the same dimensions as Cm sample.
Isotopic composition at 2005 ( data of experiment)
2 ug Cm-oxide, deposited on 30 um thick Al backing,
Cm-243 fission cross section at 5.38 meV was determined
Contribution of impurity fissions subtracted by
using the Cm-244 and Pu-239 fission cross sections from
JEFF-3.0 and the Cm-245 fission cross section from

x4freetext: 2 ug Cm-oxide, deposited on 30 um thick Al backing,
50 mm2 large surface barrier detector for
B-10 sample was used to determine dead time and
small neutron flux fluctuations via B-10(n,alpha)Li-7
Cm-246 fission cross section at 5.38 meV was determined
Contribution of impurity fissions subtracted by
using the Cm-244,247 and Pu-239 fission cross sections
from JEFF-3.0 and the Cm-245 fission cross section from
